nodes.name: StoreManagement

nodes.documentation: @dev Store name is still used in most events as the unique identifer.
nodes.name: LogStoreOpened

nodes.documentation: @dev Emit when a product with set price is created.
nodes.name: LogNewSetPriceProduct

nodes.documentation: @dev Emit when inventory of a product is increased.
nodes.name: LogAddedInventory

nodes.documentation: @dev Emit when a product is no longer being sold
nodes.name: LogProductRemoved

nodes.documentation: @dev Let the world know of price changes
nodes.name: LogPriceChange

nodes.documentation: @dev Emit when an admin is added to a store
nodes.name: LogNewAdmin

nodes.documentation: @dev Emit when an admin is removed from a store
nodes.name: LogAdminRemoved

nodes.documentation:
@dev Uses current store to determine if they are an admin, allowing them to
 act on the store for which they are an admin. Recall that the 0-index
 of the storeAdmins array holds the owner address. Therefore any function
 which uses this modifier can be also accessed by the owner!
nodes.name: onlyStoreAdmin

nodes.documentation: @dev Uses store mappings to determine if the msg.sender is the owner.
nodes.name: onlyStoreOwner
openStore
createStoreAdmin
removeStoreAdmin
createSetPriceProduct
addInventory
changePrice
